title.narrative: Cote d' Ivoire - Improving Surveillance, Diagnostics, Control and Reporting Systems

description.narrative: This workshop aims to build phytosanitary border inspectors capacities on practical tools for Inspection, Sampling procedures and Pest Identification, to help promote quarantine operations and safe trade of plants and plant products in West Africa.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Dominican Republic - Fruit Fly Trapping and Record Keeping

description.narrative: An initial meeting was held at the DR Ministry of Agriculture (MA) Plant Health Department with the DR NPPO to discuss and follow up on fruit fly trapping program in DR. Several recommendations were provided in order to improve the program and to expedite the weekly FF trapping reports. On Wednesday April 27, a workshop addressed to field inspectors was held emphasizing the importance of reporting and the use of the Fruit fly database for monitoring and implementation of control measures.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: The Food for Progress Program provides for the donation of U.S. agricultural commodities to developing countries and emerging democracies that are committed to introducing or expanding free enterprise in their agricultural economies. The program has two primary strategic objectives: (1) increase agricultural productivity and (2) expand trade of agricultural products.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles
